intro: Androsace cinerascens, commonly known as the cinerascens rockjumper, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early summer. Its leaves are generally hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions. Androsace cinerascens is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
